intro: Nothoscordum ineanum, commonly known as the Mexican garlic plant, is a flowering plant in the Amaryllidaceae family. It is native to Mexico and is characterized by its bulbous, garlic-scented underground stem. The plant produces tall, narrow leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and its mild, garlic-like fragrance. Nothoscordum ineanum is relatively drought-tolerant and thrives in well-drained soil.
